page.title: 04Housing in Stanbury
page.content: The houses in{Stanbury}are built of stone.Some have stone roofs but most have slate.There are one or two detached houses.Some are built in pairs but most are terraced.There are cottages of various sizes.Most of the houses are built up to the road side.These houses do not have gardens.There are some houses behind these.They have large gardens. The houses have central heating,gas, electric or coal fires.Most villagers use gas or electric cookers.They used to cook over open fires or on a cast-iron range. {Mr Jones'}house was built in{1816. It is a stone cottage with a pitched slate roof.It has modern furniture. Many of the cottages have antique furniture to add character. .
